intro: Leucopogon appressus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Leucopogon appressus is adapted to fire-prone environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
